snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio held an impromptu news conference to announce the deal with unions representing 12,000 high-ranking officers, including police captains, sanitation chiefs and deputy jail wardens.
abstract: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio announces agreement reached with eight labor unions that will give high-ranking officers, including police captains, sanitation chiefs and deputy jail wardens, 11 percent raise over seven years.

byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio held an impromptu news conference to announce the deal with unions representing 12,000 high-ranking officers, including police captains, sanitation chiefs and deputy jail wardens.

headline.main: New York City and 8 Labor Unions Reach Tentative Contract
headline.print_headline: City and 8 Labor Unions Reach Tentative Contract
